title: Yasuo is NOT a general go to champ
body: STOP picking the bloody champ because you think he's so "braindead ez gg". If you don't have sufficient skill on the champion to carry you through the early game, REFRAIN from picking him in ranked games please. Go feed 100 games of normals on him before blindly picking the champ thinking he'll be an "easy" win. You're only deluding yourself and setting your team at an inherent disadvantage.

replies.body:
To be fair, Yas is really easy to play mechanically. He is just super hard to not feed on.

Everything about his kit says 'go in' but if you do it at the wrong time you just die.

He has more finesse than people give him credit for. That's like saying Udyr and Voli are easy mechanical champs. Doesn't mean they're super easy to play because most of it comes down to gameplay knowledge.

Let's not even talk about effective use of his windwall and how much people butcher that.

He does take finesse, I literally said he did. But his finesse is almost 100% decision making, not mechanical. Take riven and him. If riven goes in at a bad time she is going to be punished far less then yasuo because of how much mobility she has and her controllable shield. But her finesse has a lot more to do with mechanical prowess. Being able to fast combo and choose the proper combo (and execute it {which as much as people want to say it's easy, some of those combos require 6+ button presses at precise intervals and 2 or more ground clicks -or movement commands- in a second-1.5 seconds to pull off correctly}) at any given point in time. However with yasuo the hardest thing to do with his is actually use windwall reactively and do qe flash to move the knockup. He has the mechanical demands of a Fiora or renekton. His decision making is far harder then most other champions tho.

If riven goes in at a bad time she is going to be punished far less then yasuo because of how much mobility she has and her controllable shield. But her finesse has a lot more to do with mechanical prowess. Being able to fast combo and choose the proper combo (and execute it {which as much as people want to say it's easy, some of those combos require 6+ button presses at precise intervals and 2 or more ground clicks -or movement commands- in a second-1.5 seconds to pull off correctly}) at any given point in time. However with yasuo the hardest thing to do with his is actually use windwall reactively and do qe flash to move the knockup. He has the mechanical demands of a Fiora or renekton. His decision making is far harder then most other champions tho.

Mate you are talking at the boards, your logic needs to be of silver-gold elo. + NO renekton is easy as fk mechanichaly compared to yasuo, in fact rene has to be the easiest toplaner to do well with. You cant botch rene Q or W and E is REALLY hard to botch but you can botch yas Q(even the normal q without nado which has the width of a hair) or W and for w you need to be walking one side to the other while doing everything else.

I am silver/gold. And using an auto between each ability as renekton is about as easy as using yasuos kit. It's all aa cancels and casting abilities quickly after one another. There is nothing complicated about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Automated Riven,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4R2A15nJ,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-09T06:25:39.593+0000)
>
> I am silver/gold. And using an auto between each ability as renekton is about as easy as using yasuos kit. It's all aa cancels and casting abilities quickly after one another. There is nothing complicated about it.

If you compare them, you have to compare how hard it is to play either at the same level, not yasuo "using his kit" vs Rene "doing every single aa cancel and movement correctly". With yasuo you have to auto between each spell too by that logic to maximise your dps.And how punishing is it if you do 1 less auto compared to if you miss your nado and then cannot ult for another like 6-7 seconds? Ofcourse if you mean at challenger level all champions' skill requirements are not that far apart. But as a non toplaner, everytime i get autofilled top I just lock in Rene and never ever feed. Sure I might not carry but the difference between navigating a lane as Rene and as Yasuo is abysmal.
Also you can never hit an enemy with your Q if they have the smallest amount of skill at dodging and are not CCd by a teammate prior to the nado.
PS: I don't believe you can be gold by one-tricking riven and doing aa cancels and all the combos you mentioned earlier. I have 2 pals that even miss the aa cancels a lot compared to Box Box or Adrian and they still are easily plat 1-dia V.
I don't think you could do [this ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Jw7521fH3I)reliably if even at all.

You mean this??

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RMlh2AlRhCA&feature=youtu.be

I dont know if he is spaming taunt to make his model spazz like it does in your vid. However when comparing relative dps I hit 2600 on a 100 armor target dummy, and your guy hit about 2000 (due to his last aa hitting him with 50 damage left and bloodthirster shield) on a 69 armor ezreal. so with the new runes resulting in me having 30 extra damage (and I cant read due to idk why and had level 16 instead of 15)

Woops, My bad. I skipped an auto. 

Here is one where i  didnt skip the first auto, However my riven mechanics came through and I aa'd before the q at the end. either way i feel I have proved that this combo is rather simply and easilly replicated. 

https://youtu.be/c9woWqy-9ww
renekton? mechanics? you literally press e stun them q hydra if they arent dead yet then go back to csing.

> He does take finesse, I literally said he did. But his finesse is almost 100% decision making, not mechanical. 

As a fellow Riven main I've got to STRONGLY disagree, Yasuo is very demanding mechanically.

> However with yasuo the hardest thing to do with his is actually use windwall reactively 

Nah, there are so many small things like getting in another AA-Q before ulting or EQ

> do qe flash to move the knockup.

QE flash.. Yes, please tell me more about how much you know about Yasuo's mechanical difficulty.

Same happens with Ashe.

who ever said ashe is easy to play?

i'm a diehard ashe main, her and lucian are the hardest adcs i've ever played 
lucian because of his passive+low range+how hard it is to hit with ult
ashe because of playing an immobile adcs that can't kill in 3 hits any targets that come near her

Ashe is like, basic immobile marksmen knowledge an marksmen mechanic, BUT you don't kill as fast and instrad have a good pick and kite potential.

She's nowhere near Draven and Kalista.

> [{quoted}](name=Ryusaether,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4R2A15nJ,comment-id=00020000000100000001,timestamp=2018-05-09T06:58:44.469+0000)
>
>
> She's nowhere near Draven and Kalista.

draven is not hard, you're literally able to 4 shots anyone, people think that you have to manage your axes a lot but that's not true his damages are so high that he jjust need to catch 2 or 3 axes

kalista is only hard if you don't use the attack move button

Yeah sure, then tell me what you'll do in a teamfight when you bursted a squishy but dropped all your axes. Draven is kinda easy to win with in lane (and even there you can do much better than just "winning lane" if you're good with him), but later it's a different story. 

Kalista has low range and is much more than that (using dashes to dodge skillshot, jump over thin walls, calculate your E dmg properly, saving your supp with R etc.)

Ashe is a kiting machine with lower dmg but slow to compensate, and she literally has to just auto and position (which, suprise surprise, every marksman has to) and eventually throw an R to make important picks.

> [{quoted}](name=D357R0Y3R,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4R2A15nJ,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2018-05-08T22:58:46.966+0000)

> ashe because of playing an immobile adcs that can't kill in 3 hits any targets that come near her

I guess its different for everyone. To me lucian and ashe are the 2 adcs i can play and not feed on.
I tried kalista and vayne and realised you need about a million games to play those well in any elo above gold xD
Ashe atleast has an ulti to be useful even if you are behind you can change a whole teamfight if you mask an arrow with terrain you make it nearly undodgable.
To be honest dude, the moment yasuo builds {{item:3046}} allot of his risk disappears and he wins just about every lane thanks to the damage reduction
**This ^^**

Depends what you are looking to do.

Yeah, using q or e, or e-q isn't too hard.

But auto canceling with q, or reducing q cd with e, or doing keyblades, airblades, or beyblades takes a decent bit of mechanics and practice to pull off. 

Hell, even just consistently being able to dash over walls takes a lot of practice

I don't know what any of those are. I saw a video on how to do them once but I am so God awful at respecting his power curve I don't even play him. I personally never had a problem going over walls with his e, however I play riven and played old nid before they changed her w to cast toward the curser. So it may be disproportionatly easy for me. I am willing to accept that he may be more mechanically difficult then I presented tho. (as I don't really know what your refering too)

I think he might be referring to doing E>Q>Flash for knock ups

or doing E>line Q (non circular, has better range)

or doing E>tornado Q(to mask the animation)

or doing W>tornado (to mask the animation)


and given how rarely I see yasuo's actually escape via jungle camps walls, I'd say it's a pretty tricky move to do.

its his micro, similare to Riven.

He's Janna nemesis: all her kit says stay behind and not feed.
It's easy not to feed on yasuo. It's difficult not to want to feed.
I ban yasuo every game. Every. Game. I haven’t had to deal with yasuo or a yasuo player in a year. League never felt better

usually the rest of the 3 teammates start flaming you if I'm on ur team and i want yasuo mid

its not a good thing but its usually what happens
Let them flame. More ammo for reports.
You're that guy...
Yes it's me

so I fed my 100 games with zoe. I'm ready to feed in ranked now.
/s
Stop telling people what to play, it's their decision, not yours.

It's also my LP and MY time. If you aren't coming at your 100%, find another game where people feel the same way you do. They may be able to play what they want, but I'll dictate who gets to waste my time.

Well, i have checked your match history, there were also quite some games where you didn't do really well, so you basically also stole their Time and LP? Nah, sure it's probably your jungler/midlaners/hamsters fault for not helping you.

Also, in 20+ games i've only found two Yasuo players, from which one was in the enemy team.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/392971740097150976/443659660562792448/Screenshot_600.png From the enemy team, which did way better compared to anyone in his own team.

And

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/392971740097150976/443659709480697856/Screenshot_599.png
Which had a way better score than you, and it's safe to say both didn't perform bad.

So why the complain? No Yasuo's that lost you the game, this whole posts intend is to just complain about Yasuo players and get upvotes to boost your fragile ego, not expecting anyone to think out of the box because Yasuo is a hated champion.

But heres a wakeup call, there will always be people that go skeptical against everything, and if something smells especially like lies or giberish, they will do their best to dissproof your lies, so yes, stop complaining for the sake of complaining :>

You're missing the point of the post.

He's telling people to not pick Yasuo because ''holy sh!t Yasuo open, freelo''.

Both of the Yasuo's you used as example there are familiar with the champion. The first one is a Yasuo main, and the second one mains Zed with Yasuo on the side, who seems to have played more Yasuo than Zed recently as well.

I mean seriously, look at the actual OP and compare to your comment here. He doesn't need to be speaking from his own experience, which he seemingly wasn't anyways since you couldn't find any evidence of it in his match history, which... You somehow turned in to critique against him but was actually a straw man.

Also to answer your previous comment, yes, when i coach i actually DO tell my students what to play in ranked. I don't tell them to instalock Yasuo because he's not banned and they think it's an easy champ to carry with. I tell them to find a champ they love playing, and then stick to it and practice with it- And not in ranked to start off with. You understand where this guy is coming from if i put it this way?

You're being very presumptuous and incredibly condescending all while simoultaneously being fallacious. You're telling OP he made this post just to complain about Yasuo players, but what exactly did you do? You intentionally saught out ''evidence'' to ''disprove'' him, when all it did was show your confirmation bias to a point of stance you (likely) predetermined before posting.

I can't miss a point when he misses his own point already.

This problem isn't an exception to Yasuo, anyone could get stomped in his game, think ''Omg X champ open, gotta pick'' because they think X champ is op freelo, this isn't a problem only dedicated to Yasuo...

And why i listed the Yasuo's as example is because, if he had about 80% of these games lost with a bad Yasuo on his team, then i would have been more understanding, it's tilting, shit happens, but he didn't had any negative experience with Yasuo in his recent games, so why limit ''X champion is picked without experience in ranked cos people think X champion is op'' to Yasuo?

> Also to answer your previous comment, yes, when i coach i actually DO tell my students what to play in ranked. I don't tell them to instalock Yasuo because he's not banned and they think it's an easy champ to carry with. I tell them to find a champ they love playing, and then stick to it and practice with it- And not in ranked to start off with. You understand where this guy is coming from if i put it this way?

No i don't understand where he is coming from, he is not a coach, he is a random Ranked mate, people come to you so you tell them what to do, people play random ranked Ques because they DO NOT want some random guy to tell tham what to do, you can know when your ''students'' are bad with Yasuo, he cannot, he doesn't know these persons, hence he can't tell if they first pick him or have experience with him.

And yes, he made this post just to complain about Yasuo players, else, i'll tell you how this post actually looked like

# Champions you think are OP are NOT a general go to champ

 STOP picking the bloody champs because you think they are so "braindead ez gg". If you don't have sufficient skill on the champions to carry you through the early game, REFRAIN from picking them in ranked games please. Go train 100 games of normals on them before blindly picking the a champ thinking he'll be an "easy" win. You're only deluding yourself and setting your team at an inherent disadvantage.

You see the difference? this is an universal problem, it is not a Yasuo-only problem, hence why i can't take the OP serious and just see this as another circlejerk post.

EDIT : nvm i fucked up, im delusional sorry, don't take this serious anymore, realized that what i wrote down is dumb as fuck ehhh

- What was his own point he actually missed? I actually didn't catch that. I also don't think it means you can't miss it just because he did. You would be making the point against the point he missed, which means you still hit. If he did miss it, i still cleared up what he meant to say, more like repeated it. It's really obvious (to me) what the OP's statement is.

- It is not an exception to Yasuo, but it was neither stated as an absolute. You're basically using a ''not all'' argument but swapped to ''not only''. He uses Yasuo because Yasuo is incredibly likely to be interpreted as the ''free elo pick'' currently, i assume. You could name any other champ, but that's whataboutism.

- Idunno, third paragraph just isn't very relevant. I understand how you're thinking and why you bring it up, but it's trivial. It's like a metafallacy. You're shooting the message because the messenger is stupid, the saying goes. OP could be playing devil's advocate, but it doesn't refute his statement in any way shape or form. It stands as it is, you can swap Yasuo with some other champion, but OP chose Yasuo and probably not for no reason. Name another champ if you want, but then we're back to whataboutism.

- I think people play ranked games to try and climb to a rank or get better, not because they ''do not want to be told what to do''. Also, you can actually look up your teammate's stats during champ select and know for a fact what they main. If they don't main Yasuo and never touched him in ranked, and didn't play him in their last 20 matches, maybe you should tell your ranked mates not to pick Yasuo- For your own sake AND theirs- Or dodge. Again, nobody can tell you what to do, just like you won't stop an inter from running it down mid by saying ''stop''. Point being, yes he can know when people are unlikely to know how to play the champ they want to choose. There's two websites that i knew of (I forgot the names sadly cuz i dont use them) which lets you see your teammates' stats with the click of a button during champ select. A lot of youtubers/streamers use it when smurfing, you may have noticed them dodging because of it. I don't even think this is relevant to OP either, he probably doesn't do it himself, but i'm entertaining the notion.

- He is not making the post you presume to be the correct way of addressing the issue because OP finds Yasuo more relevant than saying ''freelo champs''. I see the difference, but they're both saying the exact same thing. It still is the exact same message. You can word it violently or you can word it kindly, you can word it using specifics or you can word it using general terms. It's the same message, but what you did was wordsmithing.

https://imgur.com/aumdHlO
https://imgur.com/ic2BvD2
https://imgur.com/mDdUz4V





Notice the trend of games I've lost? 

And the account isn't a "smurf". I have 3 different accounts I play on just to keep my sanity. Current ranks of other 2:

https://imgur.com/qYKlJym
https://imgur.com/zkVIjTD

They're all basically plat accounts. I included the top champion on those accounts as well for you to see they aren't just "random" accounts. This isn't empty complaining. Just because you can't see the evidence, doesn't mean it doesn't exist.
he is the general cancer champ
Maybe we could not discriminate against people who play Yasuo?

If you're a yasuo main and have decent amount of games and knowledge on him, I won't bash you. You play him 10 or so games, think you can get away by picking him because he's easy to play and proceed to be a typical yasuo player, then I have a huge issue with you playing him.

I try to give them benefits of the doubt, I do. But every time it falls flat and I end up losing 90% of the time I get Yasuo on my team.

Doesn't really matter. You're spreading a stereotype on people which these boards have enough of.

Plus this post is just a rant.
bc it's true. People blind-picking yas top /mid when they have a 20-30 percent win rate with him. Of all the league "stereoptypes", the yas ones are the most accurate.

I guess all racism and sexism is justified because 'it's true'. /s

Why would you ever think any kind of stereotyping was good?
